Sunglasses as a tool for art: Artists can use sunglasses as a unique medium for creating art, such as painting or drawing on the lenses or frames, or even using them as a sculpture material.
Sunglasses as a lighting tool: Sunglasses can be used as a makeshift flashlight or headlamp by shining a light through the lenses or attaching a light source to the frames.
Sunglasses as a navigation tool: Sunglasses can be used as a compass or directional tool by using the polarization of the lenses to determine the direction of the sun.
Sunglasses as a musical instrument: Sunglasses can be used as a percussion instrument by tapping on the lenses or frames to create different sounds and rhythms.
Sunglasses as a protective gear for sports: Sunglasses can be used as a protective gear for sports such as baseball, where they can be used to shield the eyes from the sun and reduce glare.
